text:
Meanwhile, a big chunk of “rural” America is transforming into suburbs of fast-growing metro areas.

text:
And while these days nobody would call Detroit or Cleveland or Milwaukee a “superstar city” these very much aren’t small towns or anything like it. 

They’re big cities that have been shrinking and hollowing out.

text:
You saw something along these lines when the UAW tried to organize Volkswagen in Tennessee.

The company was about as non-hostile as a company ever gets, but the local GOP was vehemently negative and in a red state that carried the day.

Unions are for Democrats.
author: mattyglesias

text:
Part of the promise of unions is that as job-based organizations they give people a basis for thinking about politics that can transcend culture war stuff. 

Trump’s calculus is you can run this in reverse — you know the union is bad because it backs Democrats.

text:
There are like eighty million things people care passionately about in politics, and Federal Reserve Board seats are not one of them. 

But the choices you make on them will shape everything else you deal with.

text: Conversely, you can be thoughtful, competent, well-meaning Obama and grind through a painfully slow recovery because your competent well-qualified Fed chairs are inclined to err on the side of being cautious.
author: mattyglesias

text:
Something I hope Democrats take away from the Trump years is that Fed appointment really really really matter.

Your administration can be a total shitshow in almost every possible way, but if you get a pro-growth Fed that will cover many many many sins.

text:
Beto beat the state-adjusted fundamentals by ~2 points, Klobuchar by ~15 and the Minnesota electorate is much more similar to the key swing states. 

Admittedly, he had to face an incumbent and she was up against a nobody. But then again the incumbent was Ted Cruz.

text:
Obviously Ikea, the fruit of both Nordic ingenuity and weird tax shelters, is the most neoliberal store. 

Also a really good illustration of the concept of low-end disruption that doesn’t involve annoying tech weirdos.

text: Folks, on the playground today my son was being a lot more boisterous than the little girl from he class he was paying with and her mom attributed that to gender differences and I congratulated her for her bravery in speaking up on this important topic.

text:
While I have you here, let me note that the online streaming video world is a clear illustration that within reason “market concentration” isn’t always a bad thing. 

Nobody wants to pick from 27 separate online content bundles, we’d be best off with like 3 or 4.
author: mattyglesias

text:
The fast casual chain burrito — loosely “Mexican” but really from California but actually the company is from Colorado and the food is identical everywhere — is, as of today, the most neoliberal food. 

Someday, though, we’ll get a big national Korean taco chain.
author: mattyglesias

text:
It was an honor just to be nominated.
